thread.title: Sport on the BBC: The best of this week's action
thread.title_full: Sport on the BBC: The best of this week's action

title: Sport on the BBC: The best of this week's action
text:
Read more about sharing. Manchester United and Southampton will contest the first silverware of the season in the 50th League Cup final to be staged at Wembley Find out the details of the major sports coverage on offer across BBC television, radio and online this week. 
Visit our live guide for direct links to all our live sporting coverage - including text commentaries - while BBC Sport app users can also set event reminders so they never miss a moment of their favourite sports. 
All times GMT. Fixtures and event start times are subject to change. The BBC is not responsible for any changes that may be made. For more details of forthcoming coverage, visit the specific sport's page on the website. Coverage on BBC Red Button can be subject to late schedule changes. Wednesday, 22 February 
Leicester travel to Sevilla in the Champions League, with build-up, live commentary and reaction on BBC Radio 5 live. 
19:45-22:00, Football - Sevilla v Leicester City, Champions League, BBC Radio 5 live (build-up from 18:30) 
22:00-22:30, Football - 5 live Football Social, BBC Radio 5 live Thursday, 23 February 
BBC Radio 5 live brings you a special documentary exploring how Manchester's two biggest football clubs scout for new talent, while on BBC Radio 5 live sports extra, there is live rugby league as Hull FC host Catalans Dragons. 
19:30-21:00, Football - City v United: Manchester's Cold War, BBC Radio 5 live 
19:30-22:30, Rugby league - Hull FC v Catalans Dragons, BBC Radio 5 live sports extra 
21:00-22:00, Rugby union - Six Nations preview, BBC Radio 5 live 
22:00-22:30, Football - The Premier League Show, BBC Two (23:15-23:45, BBC Two N.I.) Friday, 24 February 
Watch live coverage of the men's and women's skeleton events at the Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships, plus listen to BBC Radio 5 live sports extra coverage of the Super League clash between Warrington Wolves and Castleford Tigers. 
09:50-12:00, Winter sports - Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships, men's skeleton, BBC Red Button and online 
13:00-14:00, The Friday Sports Panel, BBC Radio 5 live 
13:50-16:00, Winter sports - Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships, women's skeleton, BBC Red Button and online 
18:00-21:00, FA People's Cup first round, Live text commentary with the best of social media and highlights clips 
18:10-20:35, Rugby union - Women's Six Nations: Scotland v Wales, Connected TV & online 
19:00-21:00, Rugby union - Scrum V: Edinburgh v Cardiff Blues, Pro 12, BBC Two Scotland, BBC Two Wales & online 
19:00-22:00, The Friday Football Social, BBC Radio 5 live (edited version 05:00-06:00, Sat 25 Feb) 
19:30-21:30, Basketball - Worcester Wolves v Plymouth Raiders, BBL Trophy semi-final, Connected TV and online 
19:30-22:30, Rugby league - Warrington Wolves v Castleford Tigers, BBC Radio 5 live sports extra 
20:25-22:25, Rugby union - Scrum V: Scotland U20 v Wales U20, Pro 12, BBC Red Button and online Saturday, 25 February 
After a break last weekend, the Six Nations is back with Scotland hosting Wales in the day's early match, live across the BBC. Other highlights include Premier League football, Challenge Cup rugby league and the Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships. 
05:00-06:00, Football - The Friday Football Social (repeat), BBC Radio 5 live 
07:20-09:30, Winter sports - Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships, Women's Skeleton, BBC Red Button and online 
09:00-11:00, The Danny Baker Show, BBC Radio 5 live 
10:00-18:00, FA People's Cup first round, Live text commentary with the best of social media and highlights clips 
11:00-12:00, Fighting Talk, BBC Radio 5 live 
12:00-13:00, Football - Football Focus, BBC One 
12:00-15:00, Football & rugby union build-up, BBC Radio 5 live 
12:20-14:30, Winter sports - Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships, Four-man bobsleigh, BBC Red Button and online 
13:00-15:00, Rugby league - Siddal v Toronto Wolfpack, Challenge Cup, Connected TV and online 
14:00-16:30, Rugby union - Scotland v Wales, Six Nations, BBC One, Connected TV and online (16:30-16:45, Forum, BBC Red Button, Connected TV and online) 
14:20-16:25, Rugby union - Scotland v Wales, Six Nations, BBC Radio 5 live sports extra 
14:30-16:30, Football - Final Score, BBC Red Button and online (until 17:30 on Connected TV) 
15:00-17:00, Football - Chelsea v Swansea City, Premier League, BBC Radio 5 live 
16:30-17:10, Football - Final Score, BBC One (not in Scotland; 16:30-17:00, BBC One N.I., 16:45-17:30, BBC Red Button and online) 
16:30-17:10, Football - Sportscene, BBC One Scotland 
16:45-18:50, Rugby union - Ireland v France, Six Nations, BBC Radio 5 live sports extra 
16:30-17:10, Football - Sportscene, BBC One Scotland 
17:00-17:30, Sports Report, BBC Radio 5 live 
17:00-17:10, Football - Final Score from NI, BBC One NI 
18:06-20:00, Football - 606, phone-in, BBC Radio 5 live 
22:00-23:30, Boxing - Gavin McDonnell v Rey Vargas, WBC super-bantamweight title, BBC Radio 5 live sports extra 
22:30-23:50, Football - Match of the Day, BBC One Sunday, 26 February 
Southampton and Manchester United face each other in the EFL Cup final at Wembley Stadium and in rugby union, the men's and women's Six Nations continue as England face Italy at Twickenham and Ireland Women host France Women in Dublin. 
07:20-09:30, Winter sports - Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships, men's skeleton, runs three and four, BBC Red Button and online 
07:35-09:00, Football - Match of the Day (repeat), BBC One 
09:00-10:00, Sportsweek, BBC Radio 5 live 
10:00-18:00, FA People's Cup first round, Live text commentary with the best of social media and highlights clips 
12:15-13:00, Football - MOTD2 Extra, BBC Two and BBC Radio 5 live 
12:20-14:30, Winter sports - Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships, four-man bobsleigh, runs three and four, BBC Red Button and online 
12:40-14:45, Rugby union - Ireland Women v France Women, Women's Six Nations, Connected TV and online 
12:55-15:00, Rugby union - Bristol v Bath, Premiership, BBC Radio 5 live sports extra 
13:00-14:55, Rugby union - Ospreys v Glasgow, Pro12, Connected TV and online 
13:30-15:30, Football - Tottenham v Stoke, Premier League, BBC Radio 5 live (build-up from 13:00) 
15:00-17:00, Rugby union - England v Italy, Six Nations, BBC Radio 5 live sports extra 
15:30-16:30, 5 live Sport - England v Italy (Six Nations) updates and build-up to the EFL Cup final, BBC Radio 5 live 
16:00-18:00, Winter sports - Bobsleigh & Skeleton World Championships highlights, BBC Two 
16:30-18:30, Football - Manchester United v Southampton, EFL Cup final, BBC Radio 5 live 
18:00-19:00, Rugby union - Six Nations Rugby Special, BBC Two (not in Wales; 23:35-00:35, BBC Two Scotland) 
18:00-19:00, Rugby union - Scrum V Six Nations Special, BBC Two Wales 
18:30-20:30, Football - 606, phone-in, BBC Radio 5 live 
23:35-00:05, Rugby union - Women's Six Nations highlights, BBC Two (00:00-00:30, BBC Two NI; 00:35-01:05, BBC Two Scotland) Monday, 27 February 
Premier League champions Leicester City take on Liverpool at the King Power Stadium, there's another chance to catch up on the weekend's Women's Six Nations action and Andrew Flintoff, Robbie Savage, and sports journalist Matthew Syed discuss the week's sporting talking points. 
13:00-13:30, Rugby union - Women's Six Nations highlights (repeat), BBC Two 
19:00-20:00, Football - The Monday Night Club, BBC Radio 5 live 
20:00-22:00, Football - Leicester v Liverpool, Premier League, BBC 5 live 
22:00-22:30, Flintoff, Savage and the Ping Pong Guy, BBC Radio 5 live 
22:45-23:30, Football - Match of the Day 2, BBC One (23:10-23:55, BBC One NI & BBC One Wales) 
23:30-00:20, Rugby league - Super League Show, BBC One (North West, North East & Cumbria, Yorks & Lincs & Yorkshire) Tuesday, 28 February 
Rafael Benitez takes his Newcastle side to face Chris Hughton's Brighton in a top-of-the-table meeting in the Championship, with build-up and full commentary on BBC Radio 5 live. 
13:00-13:50, Rugby league - Super League Show (repeat), BBC Two (repeated 16:30-18:00, BBC Red Button) 
15:30-16:30, Rugby union - Women's Six Nations highlights (repeat), BBC Red Button 
18:00-19:00, Football - FA Cup fifth round goals, BBC Red Button (repeated 22:30-00:00) 
19:00-19:10, Rugby league - Challenge Cup fourth-round draw, BBC Red Button and online 
19:00-22:30, Football - 5 live Final Score, BBC Red Button and online 
19:45-22:30, Football - Brighton v Newcastle, Championship, BBC Radio 5 live (build-up from 19:00) Wednesday, 1 March 
Manchester City host Huddersfield Town in their FA Cup fifth-round replay after a goalless draw at Kirklees Stadium, with live TV coverage on BBC One plus commentary on BBC Radio 5 live. 
19:00-19:45, Football - Manchester City v Huddersfield Town build-up, FA Cup fifth-round replay, BBC Radio 5 live 
19:30-22:00, Football - Manchester City v Huddersfield Town, FA Cup fifth-round replay, BBC One 
19:30-22:00, Football - Manchester City v Huddersfield Town - watch with 5 live commentary, FA Cup fifth-round replay, BBC Red Button and online 
19:45-22:30, Football - Manchester City v Huddersfield Town, FA Cup fifth-round replay, BBC Radio 5 live 
22:00-00:00, Football, FA Cup fifth-round goals, BBC Red Button Catch-up 
You can view BBC Sport output as well as listen to our radio sports programming on the BBC iPlayer. 
The BBC Sport website is available via desktop, mobile, tablet and app, giving fast and easy access to the live stream, text commentaries, news, reports, schedules, videos, as well as highlights of the day's action. The BBC Sport app is available free on Apple and Android devices. National and regional variations 
National and regional variations have been included in this list where possible, but please check your local listings for more detailed information. Share this page
